page.title: 13FAITH CELEBRATION. HARDWICK
page.content: The Hempnall Group gave thanks for 21 yrs working together with a fortnights celebration in April '85.The theme of healing was portrayed at Hardwick church with flowers,photos & tools.A turquoise banner 70" high,designed & embroidered locally represents Healing the Blind,with 2 hands spread over an eye.Hardwick is stitched in red on a scroll at the top,a grey dove at the bottom portrays peace.A special communion service,held part in each church of the group with pilgrims conveyed in 2 coaches,was attended by Bishop Aubrey Aitken,his last sermon before he died. The 4\ cwt bell,28\"diameter,note c sharp,dated 1743,after 100 years silence is now rung by a churchwarden.Parishioners helped to errect a frame in the collapsed tower where it was rededicated in April.
